question: You are a code expert, please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to ensure that the generated code is executable for demonstration. Create a dashboard for U.S. population changes that includes visualization design and data presentation. Output in HTML format, ensuring the file is executable.

checklist.title: Is the U.S. population data visualization complete and accurate?
checklist.description: Check whether the dashboard includes comprehensive population data visualization with appropriate metrics (total population, growth rate, demographic breakdown by age/ethnicity/gender). Verify data accuracy against reliable sources (Census Bureau, etc.). Score 0 if basic population trends are missing, 5 if only showing limited metrics, and 10 if offering comprehensive demographic insights with proper data attribution.

checklist.title: Are multiple visualization types implemented effectively?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the dashboard implements diverse chart types appropriate for different data aspects (line charts for trends over time, choropleth maps for geographic distribution, bar/pie charts for comparative analysis). Check if visualizations use D3.js or other libraries effectively. Deduct 3 points if only one visualization type is used, 5 points if charts are inappropriate for the data type, and 2 points if interactive elements are missing. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dashboard interactive with filtering and drill-down capabilities?
checklist.description: Assess if the dashboard includes user interaction features like time period selectors, state/region filters, demographic breakdowns, and data comparison tools. Interactive elements should provide smooth transitions and clear visual feedback. Deduct 5 points if filtering capabilities are absent, 3 points if drill-down functions are limited, and 2 points if interactions lack visual confirmation. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the dashboard present data insights and context effectively?
checklist.description: Review whether the dashboard goes beyond raw data display to provide meaningful context (population trends, notable migration patterns, policy implications). Check for tooltips, annotations, or narrative elements that highlight key insights. Deduct 5 points if contextual information is missing, 3 points if insights lack depth, and 2 points if annotation system is inadequate. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code handles common edge cases (missing data, loading states, browser compatibility, responsive design for different screen sizes). Code should include error handling for data fetching failures and graceful degradation. Give 10 points for comprehensive error handling and responsive design, 5 points for partial implementation, and 0 points if critical failures occur under normal usage scenarios.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the dashboard includes unique features enhancing user experience (e.g., 1. AI-powered trend predictions 2. Custom population comparison tool 3. Time-lapse visualization of demographic shifts). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Duplicate visualizations showing the same data in different formats without adding new insights 2. Unnecessary UI elements not related to population data analysis 3. Heavy animations or effects that impair dashboard performance. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if core visualization functions are compromised by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (separation of data processing, visualization rendering, and UI components), code reusability, and performance optimization. Deduct 5 points for global variable overuse or poor encapsulation; deduct 3 points if the data loading process lacks optimization (no data caching or preloading); deduct 2 points if rendering performance drops significantly with larger datasets. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the dashboard follows data visualization best practices: 1) Color scheme is accessible and distinguishable (including for color-blind users) 2) Information hierarchy is clear with logical layout 3) Typography enhances readability (consistent font families, appropriate size hierarchy). Deduct 3 points for cluttered layout, 5 points for poor color choices that hinder data interpretation, and 2 points for inconsistent visual language across dashboard components. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether transitions and interactions feel natural: 1) Data filtering responds within 300ms 2) Chart animations have appropriate easing functions and duration 3) Loading states provide visual feedback. Deduct 5 points for laggy transitions when changing views, 3 points for abrupt visual changes without proper transitions, and 2 points for confusing interaction patterns that lack affordance cues. The full score is 10 points.
